intro: Daiswa dunniana, commonly known as the yellow daisies, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and thistles. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the dry season. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly seen in its natural habitat.
